meanings.definition: The events that will necessarily happen to a particular person or thing in the future.
meanings.sent1: She often pondered about the destinies of her favorite characters in the storybooks.
meanings.sent2: People believe in different destinies, some think they are predetermined while others believe in free will.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to contemplate the destinies of the mice in the garden, making the situation quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The destinies of the planets in the solar system are like a carefully choreographed dance in the vast universe.
meanings.sent5: The old wise man shared tales of destinies intertwined with the threads of time, captivating his audience.

meanings.definition: The hidden power believed to control what will happen in the future.
meanings.sent1: Legends speak of a mystical amulet that holds the destinies of all who possess it.
meanings.sent2: Some cultures believe in the existence of spirits that guide destinies towards a certain path.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller claimed to have a crystal ball that could reveal the destinies of her clients, adding a mysterious aura to her readings.
meanings.sent4: The ancient tree in the forest was said to be the keeper of destinies, its roots intertwined with the fate of the land.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted a cloaked figure holding the strings of destinies, symbolizing the unseen forces at play in life.

meanings.definition: The ultimate agency that predetermines the course of events.
meanings.sent1: In some mythologies, gods are believed to be the arbiters of destinies, shaping the world according to their will.
meanings.sent2: The philosopher pondered whether destinies were fixed or if individuals could alter their own paths through choices.
meanings.sent3: The magic eight ball was jokingly referred to as the decider of destinies during game nights with friends.
meanings.sent4: The ancient prophecy foretold the rise of a hero who would challenge the destinies set by the gods.
meanings.sent5: The concept of destinies intertwined with the idea of fate, creating a sense of inevitability in the minds of many.
